website_summaries.verdict: A little more expensive, but you get a lot and don't have to worry about the top 11 allergy contaminants.
pros: Made in an allergy-friendly facility, no wheat, dairy, fish, shellfish, peanut, tree nut, soy, egg, mustard, sesame, or sulfites
Does a good job with baked goods, particularly cookies
cons: While this is a measure-for-measure product, you'll have to add liquids to some baked goods to get the end result right
Check the labeling on the bag carefully

customer_reviews.title: The closest thing we've seen to regular flour in 30 years.
customer_reviews.text: I have several people in my life who can't have gluten. One is intolerant, another is full Celiac Sprue. Both buy this and I have to say it's the only GF flour I've ever had that comes so close to approximating the action of wheat flour. Christmas cookies made of this come out very very close to regular flour cookies. People can't tell the difference. Unlike a lot of GF flour, it doesn't produce crumbly or dense product. Super expensive, I admit, but for baking that really requires it, we use this. For less critical stuff, we get cheaper GF flour that's not as good.
customer_reviews.author: MarsTwain

customer_reviews.title: Really pleased!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this product! Really pleased with it. Cookies turned out better than with regular flour. Cinnamon rolls raised nicely- but I overbaked them hoping they'd turn golden brown. This was my inexperience. Next time, I'll pull them about 5-7 min sooner. Cannot wait to bake some more!
customer_reviews.author: JeannieWeanie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent 1:1 ratio to regular flour!
customer_reviews.text: This flour works really well. I've tried over 4 recipes, and a 1:1 ratio to regular flour worked wonderfully. And there are several sealed bags of flour in the box you can open one at a time, so it doesn't go bad. Also, reasonably priced in comparison to other gluten free flour. As a person with celiac disease, I'm definitely sticking with this brand!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Reed

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy
customer_reviews.text: I don’t leave reviews very often... but do not waste your money on this product. I am a qualified baker... I know my way around the kitchen so I’m confident this isn’t user error. I’ve worked with this flour with cookies, pancakes, pizza dough, and they all turn out the same way. DOES NOT COOK... stays gooey no matter how long you bake it for. I even went so far as to follow exact recipe on the box and... no, didn’t bake. Gooey yet burnt on the bottom. I am super unhappy with the purchase because this was NOT cheap.
customer_reviews.author: deanna

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, TERRIBLE product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Made bread yesterday and it didn’t rise enough. I was left with a VERY heavy, dense “bread” which I threw in the trash; waste of time and money. Made a second loaf today with the same results. Need I say I will NEVER purchase this product again and will stick with Pamela’s or Bob’s Red Mill. At LEAST those flour rise and create nice, airy loaves of bread. This one not so much!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kuuipo

customer_reviews.title: The best gluten free flour mixture on the market!
customer_reviews.text: The first time I made the dinner rolls from the recipe on the back of the box I almost cried, they were so good. My son did not believe they were gluten free because they were actually fluffy. I used it to make Irish soda bread for St. Patrick's Day and it was tender and light. I have used this flour with great success in every single recipe I've tried with it. I think the difference is the pectin, which must give the batter some stretch. I can't wait to try soft pretzels and pizza crust. It is definitely worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: KristinJ

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am a very experienced GF baker and have been looking for a pre-mixed GF flour to use instead of having to mix all of the different flours myself. I really, really Wanted to like this product! I’ve made 3 things with the Better Batter flour blend and was very disappointed with all of them. The finished products were dense and had an unpleasant background taste. I guess I’ll stick to mixing my own blends.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic!!
customer_reviews.text: This really does substitute cup for cup and makes baked goods taste the same as "regular flour". As a celiac I have tried so many different brands of gluten free flour over the years (even tried making my own) and nothing has worked well or tasted "right" until I found Better Batter! I can make my Grandmother's World War II cake again and it tastes the same as it did when I was a kid! This product is fantastic. Anyone who needs to eat gluten free should use this for baking, is great as coating for fried chicken, zucchini, onions rings, all kinds of things. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: K. KingTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great gluten free blend
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, and with the right resources, yields nice baked goods! I personally like this because I love the chewier texture of rice/tapioca breads, etc. As long as you understand that the taste and texture of traditional wheat bread can not be replicated with this blend (and vice versa), you will love it! Also, do not expect this to brown as much as wheat bread, it will look paler. This box contains 4 smaller individually sealed bags, a nice touch to ensure it stays fresh, and makes it convenient to use without having to deal with a large bag. It's a small detail but it's nice to have. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: caroline j suh

customer_reviews.title: Sour taste
customer_reviews.text: After reading all great reviews I bought it. Tried making chocolate chip cookies with this And it was so sour, i’m not sure if it went bad the expiration date is not even close to being expired. Has anyone else had this experience with a sour taste in flour? My dough consisted of, earth balance butter, sugar, brown sugar, maple syrup, this flour and baking soda and corn starch. None of the other ingredients had any sour taste to it.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Better Batter is the best!
customer_reviews.text: Better Batter makes an exceptional high quality product. I use it in baking bread in the bread machine with a GF recipe. I bake cookies, cornbread and sponge cake using regular recipes and have excellent results. Even a regular pie dough recipe turns out flaky. I use to make my own flour with ingredients I bought at the store and then did the math. Better Batter was only a couple of dollars more for the 5 lb box. It’s worth the money to be able to buy it. I highly recommend Better Batter flour.
customer_reviews.author: Marysville

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best flour replacement...but VERY, VERY pricey
customer_reviews.text: Better Batter is the only thing I've found that comes even close to mimicking regular all-purpose flour for texture in the finished product. If it didn't work so well there's no way I'd spend so much on it (it's over 10x the price of regular flour per pound). I really want to lower the rating simply because of the price, but the product truly is worthy of 5 stars. I'd love to use it in everything but can only justify using it for baked goods. For thickening or coatings I reach for more reasonably priced blends.
customer_reviews.author: M. A.

customer_reviews.title: Great Baking Flour
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent gluten free flour. I can make the best "tortillas" that look and taste as good as the wheat product. I've been using Better Batter for several months now and I'm completely satisfied. I've tried other gluten free flours but this is simply the best one I've come across. The reviews posted on Amazon were very helpful too.
customer_reviews.author: A "Rori" Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: GREAT product with consistent texture and flavor!
customer_reviews.text: I mainly get my recipes from Gluten Free on a Shoestring (she has a blog, and a variety of cookbooks available on Amazon - I just bought). I'd tried out several other blends that were easier to get ahold of (wish they carried this in-store!) before finally deciding to break down and order a box of this. Wish I had tried it a long time ago! Before I was constantly struggling with my recipes. Now they just work. It's awesome.
customer_reviews.author: James Bears

customer_reviews.title: This flour is for people who eat Gluten-Free
customer_reviews.text: I used this flour at my son's house to make Banana Bread. It was my first time to use this flour. (I have not used my Gluten-free flour yet). But, it worked just like regular flour. I followed the normal recipe and the Banana Bread was high and very flavorful. In fact, it was eaten by everyone in 2 days after school. I will definitely use this Gluten-Free flour for my baking. In fact, I see some bananas that are ready for making Banana Bread and other treats!
customer_reviews.author: Patsy

customer_reviews.title: Way too much Xanthan Gum
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting to try this brand for a while now. I was very excited about it. So far, I've made chocolate chip cookies, bread and pancakes. Following the box's directions completely. It's a struggle to the point where I dread working with this dough. The taste is fine, good even, but SO STICKY and difficult to work with that it makes the final product very dense. And no matter how much liquid I add or hold back on flour, I cannot get it to a smooth consistency. It's a mess. I spent $37 for a 5 lb box, so I'll use it up because I can't stand to waste food, but I'll never purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: brturner847

customer_reviews.title: Best GF flour for baking I've found
customer_reviews.text: I have searched for a long time for GF flour that isnt gritty, heavy, or heavily flavored (coconut and spelt) and actually behaves like regular AP flour. I've only made cookies with it so far, bread will be next, but I'm sold. A lot have complained about the cost, I know it's expensive, but I also feel like I am getting my money's worth in this product. I no longer feel like I need to warn people or apologise for things I make that are GF and I dont feel like I'm missing out on familiar flavors and textures. This flour is excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Mantis

customer_reviews.title: Baking Gluten Free is a new experience
customer_reviews.text: I made two items with Better Batter Gluten-Free Flour. One turned out perfect, but the other was definitely not! My kolachy were delicious using my recipe cup for cup Better Batter GF flour for all purpose flour. However,the yeast dough for the danish did not turn out too good. It ended up being hard. Could have been something I did wrong (no doubt was), but I'll need to try again.
customer_reviews.author: spidersmate

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST!
customer_reviews.text: I am a retired chef who comes from a Viennese family. I used to come home after days in High School and bake cakes! Many years ago, I found I became allergic to both wheat and corn. After much trial and error, I have found Better Batter gluten-free flour to be the best to suit my needs. I use it in all my cake and pie crust and bread recipes, never being disappointed. I have also recommended it to many people who have asked me about my staples.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Weihs

customer_reviews.title: Won’t buy it again
customer_reviews.text: Cake came out gummy—It browned and rose beautifully to the top of the loaf pan then sank to a solid one inch mess when it cooled off. I had to throw it out. Pancakes we’re flat and gooey inside. Cookies were okay, but I won’t buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: karkangel

customer_reviews.title: Truly a cup-for-cup all in one! Finally!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product! Finally something that seems fool-proof... I am so tired of complicated blends of flours all the time. The chocolate chip cookie recipe was wonderful and none of my gluten-loving friends noticed the difference! I bought this because I use Nicole Hunn’s Gluten Free on A Shoestring cookbooks so much and she recommended it. I’m so thankful that I tried it! Also, it seems cheaper and faster to order through Amazon than through the actual company website. No matter what it is a lifesaver for gluten-free cooks!
customer_reviews.author: M.A.

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect GF Substitute for Challah!
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST gluten-free flour I have ever used and let me tell you, I have tried a LOT of different kinds. Also, if you have not tried Better Batter's challah recipe, please go google it right now. While it is not suitable for hamotzei, it is perfect for sandwiches, dunking in soup, French toast and so much more. Not impossibly dense, like other recipes! You can pour it into one of those braided challah molds/pans to even get the authentic look of braided challah! Please do yourself a favor and try this flour today. Seriously, you'll wonder why you didn't do it sooner!
customer_reviews.author: mzungu

customer_reviews.title: Best GF flour mix for 1:1 substitute in baking
customer_reviews.text: Been GF for 5+yrs and I used to prefer to mix my own flours when baking. However, I was looking for a non-yeast cinnamon roll recipe and the author recommended this brand. One day free shipping got it to me in time to make them for Easter morning and now that recipe is my go-to for holiday cinnamon rolls. Last Christmas I used this flour as a 1:1 substitute for all my family traditional cookies - worked perfectly and all were surprised that the cookies were GF! Now will always have this flour mix on hand!!!
customer_reviews.author: Fun in the sun

customer_reviews.title: the texture is better.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried about every gluten free flour blend there is. This one is ok. It does not work well in any of my pancake, waffle, or muffin recipes. There's just too much gum in the finished texture leaving people wondering if things aren't fully baked. If I mix it half-and-half with King Arthur gluten free WITHOUT xanthan gum, the texture is better.
customer_reviews.author: Matt J

customer_reviews.title: Save yourself the trouble, and look somewhere else.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know why there are so many good reviews. This flour is one of the WORST GF flours I’ve ever tried. Every batter becomes SUPER thick. To give you perspective, I tried making GF crepe batter with this flour, I cut the amount of flour called for IN HALF, and it still turned out like pancake batter - maybe even a little thicker. (If you’re not familiar with crepe batter, it’s supposed to be superrrr runny.) Long story short: Buy other flour. I suggest Cup4Cup by a mile.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product.  Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: If you are new to the gluten free world or just looking for an easy way to make GF products, I highly recommend this flour. I bought 10 pounds the first time and within a month now I have a 25 pound bag on backorder. It truly makes baking and cooking enjoyable again. If you look at the recipes on the BB page, there are a lot of recipes for bread, I tried a few until I found one that worked for me. I would also recommend the books by Nicole Hunn.
customer_reviews.author: E. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: favorite recipes, using that blend
customer_reviews.text: Nearly 15 years ago my husband was diagnosed with celiac's, & my cooking & baking challenges began. Years ago I began using a GF blend, & re-developed many of my old, favorite recipes, using that blend. However, after our oldest daughter needed to go GF, she discovered Better Batter, loves it, & it is all she uses. Because she & one of her daughters have problems, also, with corn (my blend has corn starch in it), the Better Batter has been perfect for them. I keep the Better Batter on hand to use whenever I want to make something I will be sharing with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great flour!
customer_reviews.text: This year, I started a gluten-free diet due to food allergies. I'm still trying to find a flour blend that pleases. While Bob's Red Mill is my favorite for many things (including gravy), the Better Batter is a great multipurpose gluten-free flour for baking cookies and drop biscuits. This is a rice flour-based mix, whereas Bob's Red Mill all purpose gluten-free is blended with bean and sorghum flours. It really depends on what you are cooking and your taste. For me, rice flour blends aren't my favorite, but they are good for cookies and biscuits. Bob's Red Mill is better for bread, gravy and breading.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a great gluten free flour!
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend is gluten intolerant so I try to make meals that he can eat, but also meals that my daughter and I feel like we're not giving up our wheat flour bread. One thing was pizza! Gluten free pizza is so darn expensive so I have been determined to find the right GF flour and recipe for pizza dough... this is the flour! Raises just like wheat flour and tastes so good! I've even made dinner rolls, and we are all so happy! Definitely my go to GF flour. I ordered more because Christmas baking is just around the corner.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Faboulous
customer_reviews.text: after 8 years diagnosed celiac, and having bought and tried soooo many gf flour mixes whether boxed or my mixing...finally something that WORKS every time. I just ordered 20 pounds of it. Thank you ...thank you....thank you Now Better Batter nerds more gluten free Vegan recipes on their site please
customer_reviews.author: Anne L Murdock

customer_reviews.title: High hopes
customer_reviews.text: The recipe for basic bread on their site asked for too much sugar so needless to say it was super sweet. The flour never produced a good loaf of bread no matter how many times we tried it. Even tried putting the loaves on cooling racks for various amounts of time before cutting and it was always a blob of dense dough. Wish I could get my money back
customer_reviews.author: Prof. Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Favorite GF Flour for Baking
customer_reviews.text: I really like Better Batter for baking. But, I don't like buying food products from 3rd party sellers. This is great stuff, but do yourself a favor and buy it directly from the vendor or Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Erin D

customer_reviews.title: The BEST Gluten Free Flour around!!
customer_reviews.text: We have been Better Batter LOVERS for YEARS!! My daughter has Celiac and we have been gluten free for 10 years...so we have tried LOTS of flours on the market!! Better Batter is HANDS DOWN our absolute favorite! We can use it cup for cup for ANYTHING!!! High Five if you give it a try!!!
customer_reviews.author: KFlurry

customer_reviews.title: Superfine flour makes all the difference
customer_reviews.text: Gluten free baking is always so crumbly and inconsistent, texture-wise. Not so much here. When adapted into a bread flour (using Expandex and whey protein isolate), my gluten-consuming wife couldn't tell it was gluten free.
customer_reviews.author: TheWindowIsTransparent

customer_reviews.title: A Kitchen Staple.
customer_reviews.text: I have had my Celiac diagnosis for 17 years now and Better Batter is the only Cup for Cup flour that I believe truly functions in this way. There are still variables to baking, but the option to apply for financial aid, to use recipes from their website (Also Gluten Free on a Shoestring has many better batter recipes), and to have a ready made and less expensive alternative free me in the kitchen. I've made donuts that act like gluten filled donuts and taste as good. I never found good ones on the shelf to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kateryna F.

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness this stuff is AMAZING. I bought it because I read about it on gluten free on a shoestring and felt like it might be worth it to try. It comes in individual bags inside so you don’t waste it and the taste is amazing. I made pizza crust with it and it was SO good. I can’t wait to see what else I can make!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Puffer

customer_reviews.title: Good texture - Bad flavor
customer_reviews.text: I tried this flour because it was recommended on glutenfreeonashoestring.com. The texture was a cut above other gluten free flours I have tried - much less gritty. Unfortunately, this flour has an inescapable sour taste - very sour like lemon juice sour, or like a mixture of vinegar and lemon Pledge was sprayed on it. This might not be an issue with strongly flavored baked goods, but with sugar cookies it was a deal breaker. Updated - I am downgrading this to 1 star because they contacted me fishing for a nice review, I explained the problem & they have not gotten back to me. Also this flour tastes bad.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this for baked goods. At the price point I won’t use it for regular cooking. That being said I won’t use anything else to bake. The texture difference this flour blend makes is amazing! I’ve tried several different brands and they are all off somehow. The 2 recipes I’ve made with batter batter were out of this world delicious! Don’t waste your time or money on other blends. Just try this!
customer_reviews.author: missie schnese

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Love that it comes in handy smaller bags, making it easier to use. Instead of one big bag. Good value for the price + amount you get. Easily incorporated into any recipe, no clumping. Will recommend it to all family & friends. Will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Otto Molmen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Gluten Free Flour!
customer_reviews.text: Better Batter is the best gluten free flour I've come across in my 10 year search for really good gluten free flour that behaves like wheat flour. For the past 6 years, I've used tom sawyer gluten free flour, and it's been tolerable for things like pancakes and waffles, but a little lacking in rise power for anything else. In doing some reading recently about gf flours that absolutely give wheat flour a run for its money, I came across a recommendation for better batter and decided to give it a try. To say the least, I'm sold! Thanks Better Batter, and thanks to the seller for getting it to me quickly and in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: D. Black

customer_reviews.title: Best Flour our there...
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST gluten free flour we have ever used! Gluten eaters cannot tell a difference. Gluten-free eaters can enjoy without any concern. Can be used exactly like “flour” in all the recipes! Cooks well, no aftertaste....it’s always in my kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: L. Jefferson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: After becoming gluten-intolerant, I struggled to bake/cook gluten-free. I bought some of the typical "all-purpose" blends from the grocery store, and they always turned out less-than-stellar results or even dismal failures. When I tried buying ALL of the individual flours and mixing my own, that also didn't work. My "french bread" could have been used for self defense. My "pancakes" were lumpy, grainy piles of slush. Better Batter was my first true gluten-free success. Absolutely delicious results! So far I used it in their own muffin recipe, and then used it cup-for-cup to make amazing pie dough. I will never use another all-purpose brand again!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.text: In many groups on facebook I saw Better Batter recommended for all bread recipes. I didn't buy it because of the price. When I finally did buy it, I discovered it is a big box. It has 5 separate pouches. Now it is the only gluten free flour I buy.
customer_reviews.author: TripleR

customer_reviews.title: The best GF all purpose flour substitute
customer_reviews.text: I've been gluten free for 12 years and Better Batter is consistently the best GF flour substitute I've found. I've tried many and this one works great. I first connected with Better Batter at a GF Expo many years ago, and am so glad that Amazon carries it. It's nice to get the quick shipping with Prime!
customer_reviews.author: Linda L. Ab.

customer_reviews.title: Best gluten free flour!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best flour substitute I have used yet. Many other gluten free flour blends I found to be gritty and made my baked goods dry. This better batter flour is amazing. I have been gluten free for about a year now and it has helped my health so much. What has made is so much easier is to have products like this that still let me eat foods I'm used to without the wheat. It also has some recipes on the side of the box which are always neat to try out, I used their pie crust recipe and it was pretty darn good.
customer_reviews.author: ABailey

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy the others!!
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the BEST gluten free flour I've ever used! I made chocolate chuck cookies at Christmas and they were amazing - you couldn't even tell they were gluten free!! And this is coming from everyone at the better who didn't know they were gluten free... I thought maybe it was the recipe so tried King Arthur gf flour - and my cookies are flat and have a weird taste to them. So - buy this instead. WAY BETTER!!
customer_reviews.author: Chicago Girl

customer_reviews.title: Best Gluten Free Flour
customer_reviews.text: My all time favorite cup for cup flour. I've been using it for years! It's perfect, as are Better Batters other products like cake mixes, ECT.. Will always order BBGF !
customer_reviews.author: BobALu

customer_reviews.title: Very good flour
customer_reviews.text: I love this gf flour, it's all I use. It's best to weigh it, not just use measuring cups; it can make a big difference in the outcome. Gluten free baking can be tricky but this flour makes it easier to get good results consistently. Be patient when converting regular recipes to gluten free, it can take some tweeking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: At $38.00 for five pounds, too expensive!
customer_reviews.text: The flour performs well (just like King Arthur's Measure for Measure flour), but when I purchased this box a few weeks ago, it was about $25.00. Price gouging seems to be happening here.
customer_reviews.author: Joern Kroll

customer_reviews.title: Great flour!
customer_reviews.text: Better Batter makes the BEST GF baked goods. My family doesn’t even notice the cake or bread is gf. Contrast that to a brand name gf cake mix- we literally threw out an entire two Layer birthday cake, it was so awful!
customer_reviews.author: G.R.M.

customer_reviews.title: Better Batter
customer_reviews.text: I subscribe to a gluten free blog and the person who writes it uses Better Batter in a lot of her recipes. I thought I would try it and did not like it. I use another GF flour mix and preferred that one. This mix doesn't have the best taste and it seems a little dry when baking. I will use it up but not order anymore. Sorry
customer_reviews.author: KLM

customer_reviews.title: Great...but store in the fridge.
customer_reviews.text: I have done extensive research after my son was diagnosed with celiac disease, and this flour is in my top 3 go to flours. This is a legit flour for baking cookies especially. I am glad I found here. They don't carry this anywhere near me so getting it here was a must. One tip I highly recommend is keeping this in the fridge for storage. It got kind of "dusty" tasting after a month of leaving it in my pantry.
customer_reviews.author: Shaila

customer_reviews.title: Best Ever.
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff, it is simply the best gluten free flour I've used. Great for all kinds of baking. The results are the closest to 'regular' flour that I've found. After being diagnosed with Celiac 2 years ago, this has been a long, hard, costly road trying to find an acceptable replacement in baked goods. Better Batter is recommended by a food blogger that I follow and seriously, this flour will not let you down. Thank you for making this product!
customer_reviews.author: Cathie

customer_reviews.title: good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I like the packaging it comes in four pouches so you don't have to open it all at once. Flour performs great my recipies come out tasting good
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy now you will not regret
customer_reviews.text: This flour is thee best. I can make sugar cookies and basically anything i would normal make and no one even knows. I do not have to buy a ton of ingredients everything is in the flour without the gritty texture some gf flours have.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Food safety
customer_reviews.text: Just received the gf flour. I used this brand a while ago and was happy with it. But I wasn’t thrilled when it arrived as the box was slightly smashed. Normally I wouldn’t fuss about the packaging, as long as the product is fine, but when it comes to food, I want the item packed so no damage occurs.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy K.

customer_reviews.title: better than most GF flours
customer_reviews.text: I am not GF, but I needed to bake for a GF guest & find that this flour works well for cookies. It is difficult to get the textures just right for bakery with most GF flours.
customer_reviews.author: as

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this in several recipes so far. The texture and taste of the flour are pretty good, but my baked goods come out looking funky every time. See pic. I’m going back to using King Arthur.
customer_reviews.author: Maine Mama

customer_reviews.title: Best Gluten Free Flour on the market !
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Better Batter G/F flour, also the Biscuit and Pancake mix a couple of months ago. I was amazed at the delicious and moist Pumpkin Bread I baked for Thanksgiving, it stayed moist for days. I also made biscuits, pancakes and Never Fail Chicken and Dumplings during the holidays. My son is G/F and was amazed at how delicious all these dishes were, no dry tasteless foods, like he's experienced with other g/f products. Better Batter products are a winner in our family !!!
customer_reviews.author: Happy shopper

customer_reviews.title: Works, but doesn't taste that great.
customer_reviews.text: Very starchy, artificial texture. Too much rice and gums in the mix. Dry and "airy" texture. I was not a fan and will not be buying again. It does technically function as an all-purpose, but it is not a very good alternative to flour.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: Love My Better Batter!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Better Batter as my go-to flour for all my baking for six years. Many of my old family recipes have come out just fine substituting B.B. for standard flour. The necessary xanthan gum is already blended in, so don’t make gravy with it! But I bake my own bread (in a machine) and it is the most economical blend. Love my Better Batter!
customer_reviews.author: Vicki from Cincy

customer_reviews.title: IT WILL WORTK!
customer_reviews.text: CELIAC IS NOT THE WORST THING TO HAVE,BUT CELIACS CRAVE BREAD AND CAKE THIS MALKES THE BEST LOOK FOR Sally Lunn RECIPES
customer_reviews.author: john meyerhofer

customer_reviews.title: Gluten free flour
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the BEST GF flours I’ve used. It is a bit expensive but if your a GF user you know it’s hard to find good products.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger Peterson

customer_reviews.title: This is absolutely the worst GF flour I’ve tried to use
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely the worst GF flour I’ve tried to use. I wish I would have returned it after I first tried it since I bought a 5lb box but I thought I’d give it another shot since I had heard good things. I’ve used it 3 times and end up throwing it away as the mix is so thick it doesn’t cook. I’ve tried to thin the batter with more liquid but it just gets thicker and more difficult to work with. What a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Steph B

customer_reviews.title: Good for recipes, murder for sourdough starters
customer_reviews.text: I use this for baking. It's fine. However, I also used it to feed my gluten-free sourdough starter, and that was a bad idea. RIP sweet sour baby.
customer_reviews.author: Claire Walker

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic! Better Batter is a terrific GF flour and ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! Better Batter is a terrific GF flour and the maker writes books with great recipes with loads of helpful hints! This holiday I compared pies, breads, and noodles with other flours that I have tried...while the others are good...this one is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: bocadelrio

customer_reviews.title: We love this flour
customer_reviews.text: I have two kids with celiac and finding gluten-free options is a bear. We love this flour, great price for a great product. Now we don't have to skip baking and the kids are happy with the results, which is saying a lot. They know what gluten tastes like and this is the best we have found.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Best by far, and i think I've tried them all
customer_reviews.text: BEST by far. I've tried all different gluten-free flour blends, made my own following ATK recipe/guidelines, and even ground my own rice and nut flours... this is by far the best cup-for-cup replacement for most cooking and baking! Worth the $4/lb to buy in bulk. It stores well when sealed and in the pantry
customer_reviews.author: jrenee2010

customer_reviews.title: Not a good frying flower though.  garbonzo bean flower for that.
customer_reviews.text: Cup for cup this flour is amazing! On the other hand ordering it from the seller I ordered it from was absolutely terrible! the box was completely annihilated! The packaging was terrible and not secure!
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Best Gluten Free Flour!
customer_reviews.text: Better Batter is my preferred gluten free flour. It is not gritty like some GF flour. Have used in pie crusts, pancakes, and scones and all turned out great! Also recommended because it is also corn free and soy free.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better Batter Gluten-Free Flour
customer_reviews.text: Expensive flour but, when gluten-free is the name. This is the batter you want to use, makes cookies, cakes. All good flavor
customer_reviews.author: S. Ng

customer_reviews.title: Great one-for-one substitute for flour.
customer_reviews.text: My wife bakes with regular flour for us and with GF flour for two members of our family who have Celiac disease. This is a convenient, tasty substitute for the real thing.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Easy Swap for Grain Flour
customer_reviews.text: Such a great and delicious product and a really stellar one-to-one ratio for gluten flours. Only tough thing in my household is we still have regular flour and once the box is gone, you can't tell the difference. Also, my toddler opened a bag and decorated the livingroom with it which was a costly mistake on my end for not putting it up higher in the pantry.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Love this Mix
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several other mixes, but was still searching for something better. I've finally found it. This mix is very good quality, and is produced in the USA. I like that there are 4 individual bags inside. I contacted the company about how to use it in a particular recipe and they were quick to reply. Very eager to please. If you go on their website you will find lots of recipes. Will definitely always have this in my pantry. Thanks to Better Batter for making this available.
customer_reviews.author: B. Killinger

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I tried this product because I have an intolerance to gluten. I have a favorite family recipe Apple Bread and my husband thinks that Better Batter actually made my bread taste better. It is a little expensive but it is goos
customer_reviews.author: JACUTT

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed 😔
customer_reviews.text: After reading so many positive reviews about this flour I had high hopes of conquering a gf bread. The texture was great but it had a terrible strong after taste. Almost a sour taste. Then I made cinnamon rolls..the dough was so nice and soft and they raised beautifully and looked perfect. I tried one when they were still pretty hot and it was DIVINE! I thought FINALLY!! But no..when they cooled off that same sour after taste is very strong. Sooooo dissapointed!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Anne Ritola

customer_reviews.title: Good GF blend
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the better, if not my favorite, GF flour blends. It works well for all kinds of things. Baking, fried chicken, thickening soups, etc. Nice light flavor.
customer_reviews.author: thirty1flv

customer_reviews.title: Superior quality
customer_reviews.text: My sister-in-law said this was the best quality GF flour of all the brands (and she has baked with many brands). It's true--now that I have used many brands, I can say this is a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Stepharoo

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This is a great flour blend. Not my first attempt with GF flours, but my favorite so far for cookies! All of my gluten eating family tried the cookies I made with it and said they tasted just like Nonna's which is a huge compliment. I used her recipe but subbed the flour with this mix. I have not tried any bread recipes with it yet, but I am happy with the results so far. Shipping was great, arrived on time and in tact.
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: I've heard such good things over the years so I decided to try ...
customer_reviews.text: I've heard such good things over the years so I decided to try this blend.... I was terribly disappointed. I get much better results the ATK blend, or Bob's 1 to 1
customer_reviews.author: D M

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe the price has been raised by $11. I guess I'll have to find another one to buy.
customer_reviews.author: madatyana

customer_reviews.title: Great flour
customer_reviews.text: Really love this flour, it isn't grainy or gritty like a lot of other gluten free flour.
customer_reviews.author: turtle

customer_reviews.title: Tastes like the real thing.
customer_reviews.text: This is the closest ting to the real stuff I have tried! Pricy but worth it to be able to eat something that tastes good.
customer_reviews.author: Meme

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite
customer_reviews.text: I love better batter! They make the best products. I usually buy from them directly but after the holidays they were sold out. If you have celiac this is the best tasting flour out there
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. W

customer_reviews.title: Everything I make comes out great
customer_reviews.text: I use a ton of Gluten Free on a Shoestring's recipes from her blog. She often uses this mix and everything I've made comes out great. My family has me making plain and chocolate banana bread every week!
customer_reviews.author: Shelley

customer_reviews.title: Better Batter
customer_reviews.text: I used to buy lots of different individual flours to make my own gluten-free flour blends, which was a hassle to store and messy to mix. This stuff is great! I've used it to replace regular all-purpose flour in many recipes and I love it. People comment all the time about how they can't believe my food is GF because it is so good.
customer_reviews.author: LizG

customer_reviews.title: You can finally make your old favorites!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing! Makes perfect thickener for gravy, did not have to change my Spritz Christmas cookie recipe a bit, and excellent pancakes too so far. The non celiacs in my family for once did not complain about the gluten free items. I'm soooo happy to have found this flour.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Perreault

customer_reviews.title: Bitter After Taste
customer_reviews.text: There was a terrible metallic, bitter after taste in the 5 LB package I ordered here. I've never tasted anything so bad in any GF flour mix of any other brand I've used, which have been many. My desserts were ruined and it was embarrassing because I served them before I tasted. I threw out the flour with the desserts.
customer_reviews.author: axirad

customer_reviews.title: The BEST gluten free flour
customer_reviews.text: This GF flour is expensive but honestly the absolute best substitute I have found in the 8 years since being diagnosed celiacs. It’s a great 1:1 option especially for cookies.
customer_reviews.author: mwrjen

customer_reviews.title: New to gluten free? You are in luck my friend. Excellent gf flour for best results!
customer_reviews.text: Used in Nicole Hunn's cookbooks for gluten free baking. Her cookbooks are excellent and so is this flour. Gf isn't cheap, so you don't want bad results. Don't panic, and stop crying...gf cooking is getting better with products like this. Now go cook!
customer_reviews.author: Mary A Walker

customer_reviews.title: Nope.  I've never had so many failed baked goods all in a row in 4 years of gluten free baking.
customer_reviews.text: Still have yet to get a successful baked good from this. Not sure what I'm doing wrong. There are SO many good recipes and so many good reviews. It just has failed me EVERY TIME! And I pride myself at being quite good at gluten free baking, having been doing it for 4 years now. I'm bummed I got sucked into buying this and wasted the moolah. It's pricey, and I've been so disappointed with it.
customer_reviews.author: slecker

customer_reviews.title: Quality GF flour
customer_reviews.text: My go to gluten-free flour blend. It is excellent for most recipes. I often use it to make bread and other baked goods, such as muffins, breakfast bread, and cookies.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine R. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Very dry Flour
customer_reviews.text: This is horrible flour to bake with. Our cookies turned out very dry (we used cup for cup). They had a very sandy texture to them. Very disappointed because it came in such a big box. We will probably throw the rest out. We would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: William S.

customer_reviews.title: Gluten Free Flour
customer_reviews.text: I use this exclusively for all my GF baking. Always turns out great. The 5# box contains four 1 1.25 lb bags. However this box was missing one bag. Amazon refunded my full purchase price. This has happened once before, so I’m suspect of the p Packaging process. The box meds to be sealed so the individ bags don’t fall out.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Very consistent
customer_reviews.text: I've tried some of the other gluten free flours & love them for everyday stuff like waffles, pancakes or bread & don't mind the gritty texture. But I love this flour for things like pasta, cookies & specialty cakes. It has a very consistent color with no flecks & a very consistent texture. It doesn't feel heavy like most gluten free flour can. It's a bit more expensive, so I don't use it daily, but it's worth it when you want something to be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: BambiWatson

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: Just used it for the first time and made some amazing brownies! I will be buying more!
customer_reviews.author: The Janny Girl

customer_reviews.title: Great taste
customer_reviews.text: This gluten free product delivers, excellent taste. Easy to cook with. Made Apache Fry Bread...
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Wolff

customer_reviews.title: This stuff basically tastes just like regular flour
customer_reviews.text: This stuff basically tastes just like regular flour. We bought it to make baked goods for a friend who is allergic to both nuts and soy. She has loved everything we've baked her. We even had someone else make their signature famous beloved cookie with this substituted in and she swears it tastes the same. Perfect for all baked goods substitutions for those with a gluten-allergy.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Tastes amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best GF flour out there, in my humble opinion. I can make ANYTHING I want. Literally. With this flour blend. It's idiot proof. You can't screw up a recipe with this. It tastes amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia Tucker

customer_reviews.title: True cup for cup gluten free flour
customer_reviews.text: I love this gluten free flour. In my opinion its the only true cup for cup gluten free flour I have found (and I've tried almost all of them). I won't use anything else.
customer_reviews.author: A. Plooster

product_meta.title: Better Batter Gluten-Free Flour, A Gluten-Free Cup for Cup Alternative to Ordinary Flour, Great Tasting Customer Favorite 5 Pound Box
feature_bullets: 100% GLUTEN FREE FLOUR MIX: Perfect for gluten intolerant, vegetarian, vegan, keto and paleo lifestyles. Better Batter Gluten Free Flour also helps with the dietary requirements of celiac disease and is the perfect replacement for all purpose flour and wheat flour.

ENJOY YOUR FAVORITE RECIPES: This Cup For Cup substitute for flour allows you to enjoy a gluten-free version of all your favorite recipes. From cakes, breads and muffins to pies, pizza and pasta - you can still create all of grandma's recipes!
HIGH QUALITY INGREDIENTS: Including Rice and Brown Rice Flour, Tapioca Starch, Potato Starch, Potato Flour, Pectin and Xanthan Gum. Everything you need for a successful flour replacement in one box!

STRICTLY ALLERGEN FRIENDLY! Including Wheat/Gluten, Dairy, Fish, Shellfish, Peanut, Tree-nut, Soy, Egg AND Mustard and Sesame. Better Batter Gluten Free Flour is GMO-free, GFCO, and GMF project verified. Certified kosher by the orthodox union (OU).
OUR PROMISE: At Better Batter we believe in helping others. 10% of all earnings are donated to organizations in need. We believe that our award winning gluten-free flour can make a difference!

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
